page.title: 04INTRODUCTION.
page.content:
The Area 04920336 Today.
The area under review lies N.E.of the central area of Grantham linking the Manthorpe,Belton, Harrowby and Londonthorpe parishes. Bringing together the suburban fringe in the WITHAM valley to the rural sweep of farmland along the LINCOLN EDGE. Geologically the rocks record a Jurrasic succesion. Lower Lias sandstones and clays floor the Witham and the hills which rise away west from the area to Great Gonerby are of the same series. Eastwards however the West_facing stepped face of the Lincoln Edge forms the Harrowby and Hall7s Hills made up of Middle Lias clays, Marlstone, Upper Lias clays, Northampton sands all topped by the Lincolnshire Limestones and dipping east to the fens.
